A1: Alfred Vohrer

Q3: Who designed the sets for the film?

Q4: Where was the film shot?
A4: At the Spandau Studios and on location in West Berlin, Hamburg, and London.

Q1: What is the name of the Hong Kong comedy film directed by Philip Chan and starring Richard Ng and John Shum?
A1: The Return of Pom Pom (Chinese: 雙龍出海)

Q2: Who stars as police officer Beethoven in the film?
A2: John Shum

Q3: What is the reason for officer Beethoven's and Ng Ah Chow's transfer to a new department?
A3: They are transferred due to their former boss inspector Chan being set up after evidence is stolen by "The Flying Spider".

Q4: Who plays the role of Inspector Tien in the film?
A4: James Tin Chuen

Q5: What is the name of the thief who steals evidence in the film?
A5: The Flying Spider (Lam Ching-ying)

Q6: Who are the two officers tasked with tracking down the thief to prove Chan's innocence?
A6: Officer Beethoven and Ng Ah Chow

Q7: What is the name of the love interest of officer Ng in the film?
A7: Anna (Deannie Yip)

Q8: Who plays the role of Inspector Chan in the film?
A8: Philip Chan

Q9: How many films are there in the Pom Pom series?
A9: There are two films in the Pom Pom series, with The Return of Pom Pom being the second film.

Q10: Can you summarize the plot of the film in a few sentences?
A10: In The Return of Pom Pom, police officers Beethoven and Ng Ah Chow must track down a thief who stole evidence to prove their former boss's innocence after they are transferred to a new department run by a fearsome inspector. Along the way, they encounter their former boss inspector Chan, who is set up, and their love interest Anna.

Q1: What is the name of the Hong Kong comedy film directed by Wu Ma and starring Richard Ng and John Shum?

A2: The Lucky Stars series

Q3: What is the plot of the film?
A3: Police officers Chow (Richard Ng) and Beethoven (John Shum) must protect a witness May (May Lo Mei Mei) after she witnesses a gangland murder, while Beethoven mistakenly discovers that Chow is dying of cancer and sets out to make his last few months memorable.

Q1: Who is Joseph Ruben?
A1: Joseph Ruben is an American retired filmmaker.

Q2: What are some of the films directed by Joseph Ruben?
A2: Some of the films directed by Joseph Ruben include "The Stepfather", "Sleeping with the Enemy" starring Julia Roberts, "The Good Son" starring Macaulay Culkin and Elijah Wood, "Money Train" starring Woody Harrelson and Wesley Snipes, "Return to Paradise" starring Vince Vaughn and Joaquin Phoenix, and "Penthouse North" starring Michael Keaton and Michelle Monaghan.

Q3: What awards has Joseph Ruben won for his films?
A3: Joseph Ruben has won awards at various film festivals for his films "The Stepfather", "True Believer" starring Robert Downey Jr. and James Woods, and "Dreamscape" starring Dennis Quaid.

Q4: What is the latest film directed by Joseph Ruben?
A4: The latest film directed by Joseph Ruben is "The Politician's Wife", which he is attached to direct.

Q5: How has Joseph Ruben been accused of denying the Armenian genocide through his films?
A5: Joseph Ruben has been accused of denying the Armenian genocide through his film "The Ottoman Lieutenant", which was released around the same time as another film depicting the Armenian genocide, "The Promise". The perceived similarities between the two films have led to accusations that "The Ottoman Lieutenant" exists to deny the Armenian genocide.

Q6: How long has Joseph Ruben not worked as a director?
A6: According to the passage, Joseph Ruben has not worked as a director for six years before he is set to direct the film "Jack".

Q7: What is the name of the film that Joseph Ruben is attached to direct next?
A7: The name of the film that Joseph Ruben is attached to direct next is "The Politician's Wife", written by Nicholas Meyer.

Q8: Who is George Bowers?
A8: George Bowers is a film editor who frequently collaborates with Joseph Ruben.
